citation.title: Discovery of a Novel Inhibitor of Coronavirus 3CL Protease for the Potential Treatment of COVID-19

news.title: Pfizer's anti-viral 3CL protease inhibitor shows antiviral potential against SARS-CoV-2
news.summary: The COVID-19 pandemic has still not been countered by effective drugs or antivirals, which is the reason for the continued restrictions on mobility and social interactions in most countries the world over.

news.title: Pfizer’s novel COVID-19 antiviral heads to clinical trials
news.summary: Drugmaker Pfizer has begun Phase 1 clinical tests of PF-07304814, a small molecule that could be used to fight SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19.

news.title: Pfizer Takes Antiviral Drug PF-07304814 into Phase 1 Clinical Trial Targeting COVID-19
news.summary: Pfizer has initiated a Phase 1 clinical trial for a novel small molecule called PF-07304814, a compound targeting an enzyme that SARS-COV-2 uses to organize and multiply—the 3CL protease.

news.title: Pfizer’s novel COVID-19 antiviral heads to clinical trials
news.summary: Drugmaker Pfizer has begun Phase 1 clinical tests of PF-07304814, a small molecule that could be used to fight SARS-CoV-2, the virus that causes COVID-19.

news.title: Antivirale Medikamente: Der Wirkstoff gegen das nächste Pandemievirus
news.summary: Antivirale Medikamente: Der Wirkstoff gegen das nächste Pandemievirus Warnungen gab es viele, beherzigt wurden sie nicht: Corona traf die Medikamentenentwickler unvorbereitet.

blogs.title: Tom Lehrer's guide to design of SARS-CoV-3 main protease inhibitors for treatment of COVID-32
blogs.summary: << previous || next >>It’s been ages since my last COVID-19 post (How not to repurpose a 'drug') and I’ll kick blogging off for 2021 with a follow up to an even older post (SARS-CoV-2 main protease. Crowdsourcing, peptidomimetics and fragments)

author.name: Fragment-Based Drug Discovery & Molecular Design
author.description: The scope of the former FBDD Literature blog has been broadened to include Molecular Design although there'll still be plenty of fragment-based stuff. Comments are moderated so it may be a while before you see your comments appear.
